Name.label: Mitochondrial disorder due to a defect in mitochondrial protein synthesis

TextSection.Contents: Pontocerebellar hypoplasia type 6 (PCH6) is a rare form of pontocerebellar hypoplasia (see this term) characterized clinically at birth by hypotonia, clonus, epilepsy impaired swallowing and from infancy by progressive microencephaly, spasticity and lactic acidosis.

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))

Synonym.label: Fatal infantile encephalopathy with mitochondrial respiratory chain defects
